column4: Hi, I'm trying to continue downloading something in BitTorrent (after rebooting) and it's asking me to open location of meta file. I think this means the .torrent file, but I can't find it. It was downloaded to /tmp, but it's not there anymore. Help?
I think if you went and downloaded a new copy of the torrent file that would suffice, but I'm not sure.
I can tell you this:

I downloaded the ISO directly from a mirror.  Later I decided to share the wealth by running bittorrent to "download" the file I already had.  I downloaded the torrent file to the same directory as the ISO and then invoked btdownloadcurses just like I was downloading it fresh and that worked fine.
You mean you can't find the torrent file you downloaded.
...what?
You downloaded the .torrent file again, but now you can't find it on your HD?
I guess I mean the filepath indicated in the download status bar is wrong. It's just not where it says it is. It's not hidden, either
either that, or i'm crazy
Could be both.  ;-)
Anyway, can you try saving it somewhere else, somewhere like your Desktop?
You should be able to specify by right-clicking on the link for the .torrent file and choosing save as
it doesn't give me an option to download it anywhere else.. i will see if i can change the default
oh!
Wait, was firefox just downloading the file or was it opening a bittorrent client automatically?
Because AFAIK the default behavior when it downloads is to put stuff in the Desktop directory, not /tmp.
I tried both
If it's spawning a bittorrent client then I think it'll usually put the torrent file in /tmp.
I personally find that behavior of firefox annoying, but sais la vie, I guess.
What client are you trying to use now?
(I may have missed that part earlier)
BitTorrent
I see.  So now you've got the .torrent file but you can't get it to resume the download?
nope. .torrent file still lying about its whereabouts. nevermind, though; uTorrent is much easier to use.
